data.title: My Favourite 1950s Creature Feature: Them!
data.meta_description: Simon Dillon revisits the classic 1950s sci-fi B-movie giant ant creature feature, directed by Gordon Douglas.
data.text:
DILLON ON FILM

Some people argue children today aren’t interested in old monster flicks. Given the reaction of my own children to films like King Kong (1933), Jason and the Argonauts (1963), and my personal favourite from the glut of 1950s creature features, Them! (1954), I’m inclined to disagree. All of the above were on hard rotation in our household when my children were in their formative years. They loved them just as much as the heyday of Pixar and Marvel that they were taken to see at cinemas.

My youngest was about five or six the first time I showed him Them! We watched the film in the afternoon, and he seemed to enjoy it. In the evening, I went out (to the cinema, of course), only to return and find a note from my wife explaining that my youngest had been up most of the evening unable to sleep, because of the giant ants he kept seeing in his bedroom. She also explained that should he awaken with nightmares I would be dealing with it, which was fair enough.

Of course, I remain thoroughly unrepentant about traumatising my children with scary films. My youngest in particular loved to be scared, which is why he asked to see Them! on several further occasions. The film captured his imagination…
